channel.title: Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in Devblogs.microsoft.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Building an AI Skills Executor in .NET: Bringing Anthropic's Agent Pattern to the Microsoft Ecosystem
item.description: When Anthropic released their Agent Skills framework, they didn't just introduce a new feature. They published a blueprint for how enterprise organizations should structure AI agent capabilities. The pattern is elegant: package procedural knowledge into composable skills that AI agents can discover and apply contextually. But here's the cha Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/foundry/dotnet-ai-skills-executor-azure-openai-mcp

item.title: Masking Sensitive Data in Azure SQL
item.description: Applications often need access to data without needing access to everything. Social Security numbers, email addresses, and phone numbers are common examples. Storing them is required. Exposing them broadly is not. This is especially valuable when exposing a database to an AI agent through MCP servers like SQL MCP Server, where safety and re Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/mask-data-in-azure-sql

item.title: How can I prevent the user from changing the widths of ListView columns in version 5 of the common controls?, part 2
item.description: Last time, we had figured out how to prevent the version 5 ListView Win32 common control from resizing columns, but we noticed that the cursor st Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260206-00/?p=112045

item.title: Enable Soft Delete in Azure SQL
item.description: Sometimes applications need to remove data without actually losing it. Soft delete keeps rows in the database while making them invisible to normal application access. This is especially valuable when exposing a database to an AI agent through MCP servers like SQL MCP Server, where safety and reversibility matter. Lea Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sql/soft-delete-in-azure-sql

item.title: Securing Aspire Apps with Microsoft Entra ID
item.description: [alert type="important" heading="About the Author"]This is a guest post from Jean-Marc Prieur from Microsoft's 1ES (One Engineering System) team. We help reduce developer toil across Microsoft by making it easy to build services that are secure and compliant from the start, for instance with Aspire and Entra ID.[/alert] TL;D Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/aspire/securing-dotnet-aspire-apps-with-microsoft-entra-id

item.title: .NET Framework 3.5 Moves to Standalone Deployment in new versions of Windows
item.description: The deployment model of .NET Framework 3.5 for future versions of Windows is changing. Starting with Windows 11 Insider Preview Build 27965, .NET Framework 3.5 must be obtained as a standalone installer and is no longer included as an optional Windows component. .NET Framework 3.5 is now available as a standalone installer for legacy Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-framework-3-5-moves-to-standalone-deployment-in-new-versions-of-windows

item.title: Go 1.25.7-1 and 1.24.13-1 Microsoft builds now available
item.description: A new release of the Microsoft build of Go including security fixes is now available for download. For more information about this release and the changes included, see the table below: Microsoft Release Upstream Tag Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/go/go-1-25-7-1-and-1-24-13-1-microsoft-builds-now-available

item.title: How to Enable Microsoft Entra ID for Azure Cosmos DB (NoSQL)
item.description: Strengthen Identity Security and Eliminate Account Keys Identity is becoming the new security perimeter. As organizations modernize their cloud applications, long‑lived secrets and shared keys introduce unnecessary risk. Azure Cosmos DB now fully supports Microsoft Entra ID for both control plane and data plane access, giving custo Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/how-to-enable-microsoft-entra-id-for-azure-cosmos-db-nosql

item.title: How can I prevent the user from changing the widths of ListView columns in version 5 of the common controls?
item.description: Last time, we saw how to prevent the user from changing the widths of ListView columns, but the technique required version 6 of the common controls. What if you're stuck in the dark Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260205-00/?p=112042

item.title: Minimal GitOps for Edge Applications with Azure IoT Operations and Azure DevOps
item.description: Introduction Building and operating edge applications is a team sport, especially when you're working with Azure IoT Operations (AIO), custom Rust services, and a mix of cloud and on-prem environments. Over the past year, our team set out to create a minimal GitOps workflow that's simple enough for small pilots, but Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/ise/minimal-gitops-for-edge-applications-with-azdo

item.title: Your Home for Multi-Agent Development
item.description: VS Code has become the unified interface for all your coding agents. Manage local, background, and cloud agents in one place, use Claude and Codex agents alongside Copilot, and benefit from open standards like MCP and Agent Skills. Read the Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/vscode-blog/your-home-for-multi-agent-development

item.title: Windows MIDI Services rollout - known issues and workarounds
item.description: There's a larger blog post with the features and benefits of Windows MIDI Services coming later this month (February 2026). This is just a quick post here to assist users with known issues or workarounds, in the interest of remaining transparent on this project. We performed a ton of testing with customers, partners, and our own equ Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/windows-music-dev/windows-midi-services-rollout-known-issues-and-workarounds

These short posts (1-minute reads, we promise) highlight features the team ships that you want to know about. If you’re not already familiar with it, we recommend taking a few minutes to read this blog post for an overview and details. item.title: WinGet Configuration: Set up your dev machine in one command
item.description: I've set up a lot of dev machines in my life. Traditionally, this takes a lot of time to get everything just right, but now there's a faster way with WinGet Configuration files. Let me show you how to go from a fresh Windows install to a fully configured Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/blog/winget-configuration-set-up-your-dev-machine-in-one-command

The Super Bowl thinks that it is so important that it uses Roman numerals.) The Super Bowl is the single largest sporting event in the United States. item.title: Performance improvements to MEF-based editor productivity extensions
item.description: If you use editor productivity extensions for Visual Studio 2026, there's good news—they can now load faster! Extension developers with existing MEF-based editor productivity extensions should read this blog to learn about recent changes and how they might be affected. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/performance-improvements-to-mef-based-editor-productivity-extensions

item.title: Some small stories about the giant satellite dish antenna that was behind Microsoft Building 11
item.description: Back in the day, if you wandered into the parking area behind Building 11 on the original Redmond Microsoft campus, you would find a very large satellite dish antenna. This antenna was used for receiving video signals, such as cable television feeds for distribution to the Redmond campus. One purpose was to provide cable TV service for inte Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260203-00/?p=112035

item.title: Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer now supports Dark Mode
item.description: If you spend time in the Azure Portal’s using Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer, you know it’s a “lots of screens, lots of tabs, lots of work happening” kind of place. So I’m excited to share a small upgrade that makes a big difference: Dark Mode is now supported in Cosmos DB Data Explorer. Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cosmosdb/azure-cosmos-db-data-explorer-now-supports-dark-mode

item.title: Studying compiler error messages closely: Input file paths
item.description: A colleague was working in a project that used a number of data files to configure how the program worked. They wanted one portion of the configuration file to be included only if a particular build flag was set. Let's say that the configuration file is C:\repos\contoso\config\Contoso.config. & Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20260202-00/?p=112027

item.title: Build AI Agents with Claude Agent SDK and Microsoft Agent Framework
item.description: Microsoft Agent Framework now integrates with the Claude Agent SDK, enabling you to build AI agents powered by Claude's full agentic capabilities. This integration brings together the Agent Framework's consistent agent abstraction with Claude's powerful features, including fil Link to article: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/semantic-kernel/build-ai-agents-with-claude-agent-sdk-and-microsoft-agent-framework
